title: Understanding Anemia -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Symptoms of Anemia?
content: The symptoms of anemia vary according to the type of anemia , the underlying cause, the severity and any underlying health problems, such as hemorrhaging, ulcers, menstrual problems, or cancer . Specific symptoms of those problems may be noticed first.
The body also has a remarkable ability to compensate for early anemia. If your anemia is mild or has developed over a long period of time, you may not notice any symptoms.
Symptoms common to many types of anemia include the following:
Other symptoms are associated with specific forms of anemia.
bullets: Easy fatigue and loss of energy
Unusually rapid heart beat, particularly with exercise
Shortness of breath and headache , particularly with exercise

content_blocks.text: The symptoms of anemia vary according to the type of anemia , the underlying cause, the severity and any underlying health problems, such as hemorrhaging, ulcers, menstrual problems, or cancer . Specific symptoms of those problems may be noticed first.
The body also has a remarkable ability to compensate for early anemia. If your anemia is mild or has developed over a long period of time, you may not notice any symptoms.
Symptoms common to many types of anemia include the following:
associated_bullets: Easy fatigue and loss of energy
Unusually rapid heart beat, particularly with exercise
Shortness of breath and headache , particularly with exercise

content_blocks.text: Other symptoms are associated with specific forms of anemia.

sections.heading: Anemia Caused by Iron Deficiency
content: People with an iron deficiency may experience these symptoms:
bullets: A hunger for strange substances such as paper, ice, or dirt (a condition called pica )
Upward curvature of the nails, referred to as koilonychias
Soreness of the mouth with cracks at the corners

content_blocks.text: People with an iron deficiency may experience these symptoms:
associated_bullets: A hunger for strange substances such as paper, ice, or dirt (a condition called pica )
Upward curvature of the nails, referred to as koilonychias
Soreness of the mouth with cracks at the corners

sections.heading: Anemia Caused by Vitamin B12 Deficiency
content: People whose anemia is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin B12 may have these symptoms:
bullets: A tingling, "pins and needles" sensation in the hands or feet
A wobbly gait and difficulty walking
Clumsiness and stiffness of the arms and legs

content_blocks.text: People whose anemia is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin B12 may have these symptoms:
associated_bullets: A tingling, "pins and needles" sensation in the hands or feet
A wobbly gait and difficulty walking
Clumsiness and stiffness of the arms and legs

sections.heading: Anemia Caused by Chronic Lead Poisoning
content: Chronic lead poisoning may lead to these symptoms:
bullets: A blue-black line on the gums referred to as a lead line

content_blocks.text: Chronic lead poisoning may lead to these symptoms:
associated_bullets: A blue-black line on the gums referred to as a lead line

sections.heading: Anemia Caused by Chronic Red Blood Cell Destruction
content: Anemia caused by chronic red blood cell destruction may include these symptoms:

content_blocks.text: Anemia caused by chronic red blood cell destruction may include these symptoms:

sections.heading: Sickle Cell Anemia
content: Symptoms of sickle cell anemia may include:
bullets: Delayed growth and development in children
Episodes of severe pain, especially in the joints, abdomen , and limbs

content_blocks.text: Symptoms of sickle cell anemia may include:
associated_bullets: Delayed growth and development in children
Episodes of severe pain, especially in the joints, abdomen , and limbs

content: Symptoms of anemia caused by sudden red blood cell destruction may include:

sections.heading: Call Your Doctor About Anemia If:
content: Talk to your doctor if you have risk factors for anemia or notice any signs or symptoms of anemia including:
For women considering pregnancy, your doctor will likely recommend that you begin taking supplements , especially folate, even before conception . These supplements benefit both mother and baby.
bullets: Persistent fatigue , breathlessness, rapid heart rate , pale skin, or any other symptoms of anemia; seek emergency care for any trouble breathing or change in your heart beat.
Poor diet or inadequate dietary intake of vitamins and minerals
Symptoms of an ulcer, gastritis , hemorrhoids , bloody or tarry stools, or colorectal cancer
Concern about environmental exposure to lead
A hereditary anemia runs in your family and you would like genetic counseling before having a child

content_blocks.text: Talk to your doctor if you have risk factors for anemia or notice any signs or symptoms of anemia including:
associated_bullets: Persistent fatigue , breathlessness, rapid heart rate , pale skin, or any other symptoms of anemia; seek emergency care for any trouble breathing or change in your heart beat.
Poor diet or inadequate dietary intake of vitamins and minerals
Symptoms of an ulcer, gastritis , hemorrhoids , bloody or tarry stools, or colorectal cancer
Concern about environmental exposure to lead
A hereditary anemia runs in your family and you would like genetic counseling before having a child

meta_description: WebMD's guide to the symptoms of the various types of anemia.
